name: Curtsy
headline: Curtsy is a sustainable clothing resale app.
description:
Curtsy is [an app](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/curtsy-thrifting-delivered/id1029107786) that lets women buy and sell clothing, shoes, and accessories from their phones. 

Curtsy doesn't hold inventory; all orders ship directly from sellers to buyers. We make money by deducting a 20% fee from each sale. 

Curtsy's go-to-market strategy has been to focus on ~Gen Z women ages 15-30, who are underserved by the major players in the space like Poshmark and Ebay.
generated_description:
Curtsy is a San Francisco-based sustainable clothing resale app that launched in 2016 and was part of Y Combinator’s S16 batch. Targeting primarily Gen Z women aged 15-30, Curtsy positions itself against larger competitors like Poshmark and eBay, which often overlook this demographic. The app allows users to buy and sell clothing, shoes, and accessories directly through their phones—with all sales processed without Curtsy holding any inventory. Instead, items are shipped directly from sellers to buyers, maximizing efficiency.

The business model is straightforward: Curtsy takes a 20% commission from each sale. With a small but dedicated team of 15 employees, the app has carved out a niche by promoting not only affordability but also sustainability—a critical value for younger shoppers who are increasingly conscious of their environmental impact.

Curtsy fosters community engagement through curated collections and features items like "Best Dressed Guest" and "It Girl Brands," which resonate with its trendy user base. They leverage social media and a user-friendly app experience to facilitate a vibrant resale marketplace that is both fun and economically friendly for the users.

You can explore Curtsy's offerings on their website, [curtsyapp.com](http://curtsyapp.com/), or by downloading the app from the App Store. It’s a fresh solution for fashion lovers looking to buy or sell with ease while contributing to sustainable fashion practices.
